instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message:
hello have a 820-2936-B does not turn backlight, measurements have taken are:
F9700 = 12v
PP3V3_S0 = 3.26v
PPBUS_SW_BKL = 11.94v
PP5V_S0 = 4.98v
PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR = 0.04v wrong. After 30 seconds of setting up to 2.25V unstable
Q9706 PIN 3 8.05v.

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message: Q9706 is being told to turn on. What is on pin 4 and what is on pin 6?

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7048"]Q9706 is being told to turn on. What is on pin 4 and what is on pin 6?[/QUOTE]
Sorry Q9706 PIN 1: 0.02v 30 sec Powering unstable. 1.82v PIN 3: 8.05V 30 sec Powering unstable. 12.7V PIN 4: 12V.

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message: When there is 8V on pin 3 and 12V on pin 4 there should be 12V on pin 1. Looks like a bad Q9706 to start with, but check that LCD_BKLT_EN is high.

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7058"]When there is 8V on pin 3 and 12V on pin 4 there should be 12V on pin 1. Looks like a bad Q9706 to start with, but check that LCD_BKLT_EN is high.[/QUOTE]

there is a problem here. In Q9707 pin 2 2.29v  pin 6 0.95V  pin 4 0v (pin 5  0v LCD_BKLT_EN) pin 3 8.52v.

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message: If LCD_BKL_EN is not there do you even have an image on the LCD? Check with a flashlight.

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message:
No Title

if you have the screen image. what it is the backlight turns on the screen.

threads.title: 820-2936-B does not turn backlight
threads.message: Check LCD_BKL_EN again, it must be there. Check resistance to GND too on there.
